alert.note: Alert for Adams; Pike; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 8:16PM EST until January 03 at 11:52PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Northeast Kentucky and South Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Northeast Kentucky, Lewis. In South Central Ohio, Adams, Pike and Scioto. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over some area roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 815 PM EST, local law enforcement reported minor flooding in several roads in Pike, Adams, and Scioto counties. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Portsmouth, New Boston, Piketon, Lucasville, Rosemount, Clarktown, Blue Creek, Beaver, Rarden, Otway, Lombardsville, Mcdermott, Bear Creek, Mount Joy, West Portsmouth, Ladd, Wakefield, Turkey Creek Lake, Wamsley and Friendship.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
